name: 羅元隆
objective: The subject is designed to include two professional realms – spectral analysis and system identification. Regarding the learning of spectral analysis, the fundamentals of statistics, the introduction of random signals, correlation functions, spectral density functions, and theoretical derivation spectral analysis for SDOF systems will be introduced. The training of system identification skills is also given, followed by commonly seen civil engineering examples.
schedule:
Week01/Common Probability Functions
Week02/Introduction to Probability Distributions and Averages
Week03/Joint Probability Distributions, Ensemble Averages
Week04/Correlation
Week05/Fourier Analysis
Week06/Spectral Density
Week07/Excitation – Response Relations for Linear Systems
Week08/Transmission of Random Vibration
Week09/Mid-term Exam
Week10/Statistics of Narrow Band Processes
Week11/Accuracy of Measurements
Week12/Digital Spectral Analysis I: Discrete Fourier Transforms
Week13/Digital Spectral Analysis II: Windows and Smoothing
Week14/SDOF Spectral Analysis
Week15/Structural system identification: frequency
Week16/Structural system identification: damping
Week17/Time series simulation: AR approach
Week18/Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 10%
Mid-term Exam: 25%
Final Exam: 30%
Report: 35%
materials:
"An Introduction to Random Vibrations, Spectral & Wavelet Analysis 3/e" by D. E. Newland
"Probability Concepts in Engineering - Emphasis on Applications to Civil and
Environmental Engineering 2/e" by A. H-S Ang & W. H. Tang
